<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Desert Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2963)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

These distant cousins of creatures like [adamantine dragons](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=396)are a pale echo that lacks their relatives' power and intelligence. Desert drakes are nonetheless dangerous ambush predators, preying upon isolated desert travelers and outposts for food and supplies. Desert drakes' scales range in coloration from rust-brown to light tan and ocher shades, mimicking the colors of the dunes they call home.

 Like [frost drakes](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2962), a rampage of desert drakes often claims a huge span of territory, watching over an expanse of desert from a perch in nearby mountains or a nest among weathered ruins. Any creature visible on the surface is liable to be targeted by the drakes, especially humanoid caravans. Rampages along trade routes quickly learn to leave a member watching over each oasis for new prey. During especially lean times, the drakes will even dig out subterranean prey like [ankhravs](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=361), [giant scorpions](/Monsters.aspx?ID=356), or entire nests of [giant ants](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2824).

 Desert drakes are among the lightest and most compact of the drakes, though this shouldn't be mistaken for frailty. Their swooped-back horns and feather-thin wings are adapted to make burrowing as easy as possible. Indeed, a desert drake's powerful neck makes wriggling through sand and other loose scree as easy as walking for it.

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Desert Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2963)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Dragon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=581" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=585" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 133 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), sandstorm sight, [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet

**Languages**
[Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +3

**Con** +5

**Int** -1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Sandstorm Sight** Sandstorms don't impair a desert drake's vision; they ignore [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62)from sandstorms. They also are immune to being [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) or [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59) by sand or other grit.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +15 

**Will** +13 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 135

</row>

**Immunities**
[paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696)

**Resistances**
[cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555) 10, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10

**Wing Deflection <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The desert drake is targeted with an attack** **Effect** The desert drake raises their wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the desert drake is flying at the time they're attacked, they descend 10 feet after the attack is complete.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet; burrow 20 feet (sand only), fly 50 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +19,
**Damage** 2d12+10 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +19 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+10 bludgeoning plus [Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=47) 5 feet

**Draconic Frenzy** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The desert drake makes two fangs Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

**Sandstorm Breath** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The desert drake spits a ball of abrasive sand with a range of 60 feet that explodes into a cloud with a 15-foot-radius burst. Creatures in the area take 9d6 slashing damage (DC 27 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The desert drake can't use Sandstorm Breath again for 1d6 rounds, during which the sandstorm lingers in the area. This lingering sandstorm grants [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62)to everything within it and conceals everything outside from them.

**Speed Surge** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) **Frequency** three times per day; **Effect** The desert drake Strides or Flies twice.

**Surprise Attacker**   On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to the desert drake.

</column>
